greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal number k such that (2k)^(2^n) + 1 is prime, but (2k)^(2^m) + 1 is composite for m < n.
comment: A079706(a(n)) = 2^n which is the first occurrence of 2^n in A079706.
link: Yves Gallot et al., Generalized Fermat Prime Search
PrimeGrid, GFN Prime Search Status and History.
example: a(1) = 7 because (2*7)^(2^1) + 1 = 14^2 + 1 = 197 is prime but 14 + 1 = 15 is composite.
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Sep 17 2006
ext: Definition corrected by _T. D. Noe_, May 14 2008
a(9) through a(16) from the extensive tables of generalized Fermat primes compiled by Yves Gallot and others. - _T. D. Noe_, May 14 2008
